name: Albatross
description: Remarkably light weight for it's size, the Albatross is an impressive feat of structural engineering.

name: Black Cat Mk III
description: Signature frame of Familiar Industries; built for speed and stealth ops.

name: MC1
description: The smallest in Protos frame lineup, the MC1 provides dexterity while still maintaining their signature durability.

name: Echo I
description: A classic early mech design, the Echo I is highly sought after by collectors.

name: Black Mare
description: A simple, well designed frame, the Black Mare has unique organic shapes that make it stand out.

name: Hellion-2
description: One of Nadornia's most popular frames, the Hellion Mark 2 improves on the balance and structure of it's predecessor.

name: MB7
description: The prototypical mech frame, and one of Protos first, the MB7 continues to be a standard for mechaneers everywhere.

name: MB8
description: The bigger cousin of the MB7, this frame provides all the benefits with some extra headroom.

name: Manticore Mk 1
description: The Manticore is a towering frame with spiked rims that are known to rip melee weapons and puncture plating.

name: Hyper Rig 3500
description: A massive mining rig frame, the Hyper Rig 3500 is still used to this day in large mining operations.

name: MA9
description: Protos largest frame standing at 50 ft, the MA9 is big enough to handle any task.

name: Permafrost Composite
description: Cryobank's custom icy cool plating uses a tough composite resin base with copper cooling channels throughout

name: Nebulite Composite
description: A patented composite blend with well rounded properties and an earthy aroma

name: Aluminum
description: Industrial grade aluminum plating

name: Ballistic Fiberglass
effect: Piercing weapons do not bypass this shielding
description: Light weight but durable, perfect for speedy mech builds.

name: Copper Alloy
description: Copper with some other harder metals to improve strength

name: Erimos Steel
description: A steel alloy forged from raw Erimos ore, it is prized as an ideal armor plating

name: Fluxion
effect: Restore 2 shields every turn
description: The living metal mined in the heartlands of Zounkla.

name: Hardened Steel
description: Military grade bullet proofed steel plating

name: Scrap
description: Sometimes you just gotta patch things up, but sometimes it's the entire mech that's 'just patched up'

name: Solar Plating
effect: Provides 2 electrical power while in sunlight
description: Light weight plating with integrated solar collectors.

name: Steel
description: Industrial grade steel plating

name: Immersive Optical System
effect: A virtual reality system that drastically increases pilot immersion, while also providing reaction capabilites. After an enemy declares an attack, before they roll for a hit, you may expend 5 excess power (remaining from your previous turn) to make a Dexterity roll. On a success, you dodge the attack and do not suffer negative effects.

name: Whetstone Y-5
effect: Rockets deal +1 damage.

name: Vitreum ZX
effect: After every successful melee weapon hit you have a 50% chance to inflict Stagger.

name: Snapper-3
effect: +4 CPU

name: Polygon-A
effect: +3 CPU

name: Polygon-B
effect: +5 CPU

name: Expressivio-F1
effect: A 3ft x 3ft screen for mounting on the outside of a mech capable of displaying a plethora of preset animated and static emoticons, +5 to diplomacy while in mech. (Does not stack)

name: PAS Mk2
effect: Provides detailed analysis of damaged systems, +30MP to self mech maintenance

name: Notifi 2
effect: Provides detailed analysis of damaged systems, +20MP to self mech maintenance

name: Tyco 7
effect: Allows scanning of damaged systems to aid in maintenance and repair. Gives +40MP to other mech maintenance.

name: IntelliGate-Z
effect: Gives a map of surrounding terrain, major cities, and your location. Works on Cheilos and Okeanos.

name: NV3K "Navtron"
effect: Gives a map of surrounding terrain, major cities, and your location. Works on Cheilos, Okeanos, Vyssini, and Zounkla.

name: Glacier9
effect: A just-in-time predictive cooler controller, it keeps coolers off until they are needed (for instance for weapons or attachments), thus the power consumption of coolers controlled this way is treated as if it were an attachment that is activated right before you use an attachment that requires more cooling than is your current excess resource pool.

name: Cyclica-2
effect: You may transfer up to 3 points from any one of your resources to another. Takes 10 maintenance points to realocate.

name: Starfish-1
effect: Can schedule certain systems to shutdown if there is not enough resources for them. Systems can be organized by shutdown priority or left as only manual shutdown

name: Lemon-M2
effect: An uninterruptable power supply, if your power plants are damaged or disabled, on your following turn you may either get 8 excess power or you may use your movement.

name: Mini-Z2
effect: You may transfer up to 2 points from any one of your resources to another. Takes 10 maintenance points to realocate.

name: WG3 "Watchguard"
effect: You can schedule certain systems to only turn on at the beginning of a battle (thus they generally will not count towards your fuel consumption)

name: Hydrocarbizer
effect: Locates fossil fuel deposits within a half-mile radius.

name: Bio-X
effect: X-ray scanning shows vitals of fauna or flora as well as other things that may be revealed by X-Ray.

name: Biobase
effect: Allows you to scan many types of fauna to get basic information on them.

name: MI4432
effect: Barring any blocking signals, you are aware of nearby (~2 miles radius) large moving objects

name: Spectrome Mk1
effect: Allows scanning for faint EMF signals, allowing you to track down electronic equipment, especially power and comms stuff that is electrically noisy. It gives general directions that various signals are comming from and gives you a reading for how powerful (and therefore close) the signals are. Signal detection distance depends on the power of the signal's source, for strong sources it may detect things hundreds of miles away, for smaller stuff maybe only a mile or so.

name: UltraVis Mk1
effect: Provides an AI-enabled scanning heads-up display. Allows pilots to see enemy mech component locations

name: Tinman-A9
effect: Allows scanning for metallic objects buried underground or behind non-metallic material. Can scan to a depth of 20ft.

name: Spidercluster-8
effect: An impressive vision module with advanced entity tracking. +2 targeting. Gives count and location of all moving objects in field of view.

name: Ocumark Farscope Mk12
effect: Grants long-range telescopic vision. +3 to targeting to opponents over 500 feet away.

name: A3XC "Ace of Diamonds"
effect: +5 targeting to all hit rolls

name: PN4B "Point Blank"
effect: Allows pilots to see the number of heat signatures in adjacent rooms. +2 Targeting

name: TRK9 "Recon"
effect: +4 targeting to all hit rolls

name: Whistle Missile
description: An artillery cannon which fires a tiny missle that makes a distinct, deafening whistle.

name: Bullet Eater T90
description: One of the only weapons manufactured by MI, it is a truly terrifying gatling gun, the Bullet Eater is infamous.

name: ML70
description: A classic lightweight machine gun.

name: Weaver Y7
description: A simple light machine gun.

name: Modded X27 Mining Laser
description: When Ultraco bought entire batches of the X27 Mining Laser during a huge end of product life sale, they had something very different from mining in mind.

name: Percussion Hammer
description: A heavy hammer with a steam powered shock plate, the percussion hammer can smash through plating with brute force alone.

name: Boom Box
description: A grand innovation in acoustic weaponry, the Boom Box releases a devastating shockwave.

name: Lamprey-8
description: Fires large latching rounds that deal 2 damage each turn after the hit. Rounds can be removed for 10MP each.

name: Harpoon L-3
description: A simple harpoon cannon, common for some asteroid miners as they serve dual utility and defense purposes.

name: D1LX "Recon Breaker"
description: A terrifying blade with powered swing, the recon breaker is known to sever mech limbs with a well placed hit.

name: Cleaver J-2
description: A common choice for melee, the Choppy chain blade can rip through even hardened steel using specially plated rotating chains.

name: Ripper X3
description: The ripper is a famed chain blade that can cut through mechs like few other things.

name: Flux-Pop Mk5
description: A memorable grenade launcher.

name: KRL22 "Red V"
description: Scorpio delivers a premium payload with the Red V homing rocket system.

name: Javelin Classic
description: A recreation of the original Javelin that brought Stigma Manufacturing into the lime light, updated with a modern targeting system.

name: Euclid Mk6
effect: Allows testing samples for: Acidity, Minerals, Micro-Organisms, Hardness, Brittleness

name: Music Box
effect: Cargo 6

name: Sandchest
effect: Cargo 5

name: ItemTrunk
effect: Cargo 8

name: CP10
effect: Cargo 3

name: Redline M70
effect: Allows testing samples for: Acidity, Minerals, Viscosity, Odor

name: SuperLab 9000
effect: Allows testing samples for: Acidity, Minerals, Micro-Organisms, Flammability, Density, Conductivity, Hardness, Elasticity, Brittleness, Viscosity, Flavor, Odor

name: Mechanic's Helper
effect: Allows testing samples for: Conductivity, Hardness, Elasticity, Brittleness

name: Manta-9
effect: Toolkit 50 MP, Manipulator 65%

name: Jack's Multitool
effect: Toolkit 60 MP, Manipulator 40%

name: Surgeon-K1
effect: Toolkit 65 MP, Manipulator 90%

name: The All-in-One
effect: Toolkit 80 MP, Manipulator 50%

name: X13 Mining Laser
effect: Mining 25 kg/hr

name: X27 Mining Laser
effect: Mining 40 kg/hr

name: Glockendrill
effect: Mining 30 kg/hr

name: QL15 Mining Drill
effect: Mining 20 kg/hr

name: QX54 Mining Drill
effect: Mining 60 kg/hr

name: Proton
effect: Jump 1000 ft-tons or Boost 10000 ft-tons, choose at installation

name: Excess G12
effect: Jump 1200 ft-tons or Boost 12000 ft-tons, choose at installation

name: Pelican-2
effect: Jump 500 ft-tons or Boost 5000  ft-tons, choose at installation

name: JR15
effect: Jump 600 ft-tons or Boost 6000 ft-tons, choose at installation

name: W700 Arc Welder
effect: Toolkit 40 MP

name: Crucible Plasma Torch
effect: Toolkit 35 MP

name: Orca-18
effect: Winch 18 tons

name: Orca-30
effect: Winch 30 tons

name: WinchBuddy-L2
effect: Winch 12 tons

name: PowerHaul-EX
effect: Winch 50 tons
